macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indexes Mixed on Thursday with Microsoft Tumble Offsetting Meta Gains
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.1% to 6,969.01, Dow rose 0.1% to 49,071.56, Nasdaq dropped 0.7% to 23,685.12, and Russell 2000 edged up less than 0.1% to 2,654.78 amid volatile trading. Microsoft's shares tumbled after earnings, partially offset by Meta Platforms' gains.

items.title: S&P 500 Continues Decline into Friday Morning, Down 0.39% to 6942
items.summary: The US500 index fell to 6942 points on January 30, 2026, losing 0.39%, following a 0.60% drop to 6936 on January 29 amid broader market weakness.

items.title: Markets Brace for Fed Decision Amid Tech Earnings and AI Valuation Concerns
items.summary: US stocks lower with S&P 500 down 0.7%, Nasdaq tumbling 1.6%, and Dow falling amid tech sell-off led by Microsoft; investors eye Federal Reserve decision and heavyweight earnings.

items.title: Sharp Stock Moves: Intel Collapses, Moderna Weakens, Tesla and Meta in Focus
items.summary: Weekly losses in Dow and S&P contrasted with Nasdaq tech resilience; notable movers include Intel's collapse, Moderna weakness, and gains in Tesla, IBM, Meta amid Fed uncertainty.
items.source: Acast - The Morning After Market Brief

items.title: Insurers Collapse on Medicare Advantage Rate Proposals, Gold and Silver Hit Records
items.summary: Insurers fell sharply after Medicare Advantage proposals; gold and silver surged to record highs, oil rose on winter storms, Bitcoin rebounded on institutional buying ahead of Fed.
items.source: Acast - The Morning After Market Brief

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Plunges Below $82K Amid Deepening Crypto Selloff
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped below $82,000, down about 30% from its October 2025 all-time high, with total crypto market cap falling 6% to $2.8T; Ethereum fell 7.55% to $2,737 and Solana 7.2% to $113.89 despite bullish regulatory signals.

items.title: SEC and CFTC Chairs Signal Crypto Growth and Pension Fund Access
items.summary: SEC Chair Paul Atkins stated it's time for 401(k) plans to include crypto with guardrails, while Senate advanced draft crypto market structure legislation; this contrasts with ongoing market selloff.

items.title: Bitcoin Spot ETFs See $1.14B Weekly Outflows, Lowest Since November 2025
items.summary: Bitcoin ETFs recorded $1.14 billion in net outflows over January 20-26, led by Fidelity, Grayscale, BlackRock, and Ark; BlackRock's Bitcoin ETF now trails its Gold ETF in assets amid subdued sentiment.

items.title: Bitcoin Hits Over 2-Month Low Near $82K on ETF Outflows and Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: Bitcoin fell 2.8% to $82,159, its lowest since November 21, 2025, pressured by ETF redemptions, market sentiment, geopolitical issues, and Fed policy uncertainty favoring safe-havens like gold.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: New Light-Emitting Artificial Neurons Enable Scalable 3D AI Networks
items.summary: Researchers developed memristive blinking neurons with a tiny footprint for photonically linked 3D neural networks, achieving 91.51% accuracy on speech classification and 92.27% on MNIST digit recognition, promising compact high-performance AI hardware.

items.title: Apple Acquires Israeli Audio AI Startup Q.ai
items.summary: Apple acquired Q.ai, a startup specializing in AI for audio processing including whispered speech recognition and facial micromovement analysis, with its team and tech integrating into Apple's hardware innovations like AirPods.

items.title: WEF Report Showcases 32 Real-World AI Business Case Studies
items.summary: World Economic Forum highlighted AI applications across industries, including AMD's reinforcement learning doubling chip design productivity, CATL's hybrid AI cutting battery quality deviations by 50%, and energy optimizations reducing consumption up to 95%.

items.title: Accenture: 90% of Insurers to Boost AI Investment in 2026
items.summary: Survey of insurance executives shows plans for increased AI spending focused on revenue growth amid skills gaps, with 34% deploying AI agents enterprise-wide but challenges in data quality and employee readiness.

items.title: China Plans Space-Based AI Data Centers Within Five Years
items.summary: China announced intentions to launch orbital AI data centers over the next five years, aiming to challenge ground-based computing limitations.

items.title: IIMAKER at 2026 Chongli Forum: AI Lowers Game Content Creation Barriers
items.summary: IIMAKER discussed how generative AI enables one-person studios by compressing production cycles, but emphasized new thresholds in originality, market alignment, and asking the right questions for innovation.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Code Vein 2 Releases Today on PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC
items.summary: The highly anticipated sequel Code Vein 2 launches on January 30, 2026, across multiple platforms, marking one of the major video game releases for the month.

items.title: 52% of Game Developers Now View Generative AI as Bad for Industry
items.summary: A new Game Developers Conference survey reveals 52% of developers see gen AI negatively, up from 18% in 2024 and 30% in 2025, despite 36% using it in work.

items.title: GDC Releases 2026 State of the Industry Report
items.summary: The Game Developers Conference has published its 2026 State of the Industry Report, analyzed in a new podcast episode discussing key trends in the gaming sector.

items.title: 82% of US Game Developers Support Unionization
items.summary: A recent survey indicates 82% of US-based game developers favor unionization amid ongoing industry challenges.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: LG Electronics Secures Multiple Awards at CES 2026
items.summary: LG Electronics continues its technological dominance by earning a wide range of awards and accolades at CES 2026. The recognition highlights their innovations across various product categories.

items.title: AlphaTON Capital Presents at WSB Redacted Live Event
items.summary: AlphaTON Capital (NASDAQ: ATON) is presenting at the WSB Redacted Live Event in Miami Beach on January 29-30, featuring a keynote by CEO Brittany Kaiser on the company's $24.5M assets, $11M cash, and $4M deposit for 576 AI GPUs.

items.title: Karnataka Innovation Act Enables Regulatory Sandbox for Emerging Tech
items.summary: The Karnataka Innovation Act will create a regulatory sandbox to support emerging technologies. It is tied to the upcoming IDS 2026 event organized with MeitY and Make in India.
